item.text:
Unlocking Capital for Small Businesses Act of 2018

This bill (1) requires the Securities and Exchange Commission to establish registration requirements for private-placement brokers and finders that are no more stringent than those imposed on crowdfunding portals, and (2) otherwise modifies provisions related to private-placement brokers and finders.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 100 (Friday, June 15, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BUDD:H.R. 6127.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 3, providing the power toregulate ``commerce with foreign nations, and among theseveral states.''[Page H5225]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to create a safe harbor for finders and private placement brokers, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
